item.title: Wall Street celebrates the end of Trump’s Greenland tariff threats and expects the Supreme Court will kill the rest of them
item.description: It's like the last few days never happened.

item.title: Demis Hassabis, and how AI just might wrangle our molecular universe
item.description: This week, Fortune published a magazine feature looking inside Demis Hassabis’s Isomorphic Labs.

item.title: The U.S. was ‘the operating system of the world,’ Scott Galloway says, but now ‘the American brand is chaos, corruption, and coercion’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: CEOs are bullish but nervous: David Solomon’s Davos readout on deregulation and ‘shotgun’ policy
item.description: Ahead of his own flight to Davos, CEO David Solomon sat with the Goldman Sachs Exchanges podcast for a temperature check.

item.title: No ‘job apocalypse’: Goldman Sachs CEO denies the AI hiring nightmare is real
item.description: "Technology has been disrupting jobs, changing the way people work, destroying jobs ... for decades," David Solomon says.
